definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: Min hao knocked over the dishes, told Xia Chan dint want to see her again.
sentences.chinese: 旻皓打翻了菜肴，向夏婵表示不希望再见到她。

sentences.english: The spice imparts an hot and peppery flavor to the dish.
sentences.chinese: 这种调味品给菜肴添加一种麻辣的味道。

sentences.english: Currently, AIC can finish a dish within 2 minutes averagely .
sentences.chinese: 目前爱可平均2分钟完成一道菜肴制作。

sentences.english: Cajun food is often very salty and spicy.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯安那州的菜肴，通常都是即咸又辣。

sentences.english: Sweet and sour pork is one of the classic foods in Cantonese cuisine.
sentences.chinese: 咕噜肉是粤菜中的经典菜肴，以甜酸汁和猪肉煮成。

sentences.english: Seong says, in the North, they did not have the ingredients to make these types of dishes.
sentences.chinese: 晟说，在北方，他们没有的成分，使这些类型的菜肴。

sentences.english: Vienna claims to be the only city with a cuisine of its own.
sentences.chinese: 维也纳声称自己是唯一一座有自己的特色菜肴的城市。

sentences.english: The next is to point dish and call for drinks.
sentences.chinese: 接下来是点菜肴，喊酒水。

sentences.english: Main course: Meat, or seafood is an entree.
sentences.chinese: 肉类，海鲜类菜肴是主菜。

sentences.english: So I have lots of recipes and when I make a new dish it goes into the computer.
sentences.chinese: 因此我有许多烹饪法并且我制作新的菜肴进入电脑。

sentences.english: A Mandarin pronunciation is provided in the brackets behind each dish.
sentences.chinese: 下面的菜名中括号部分是该菜肴的中文拼音。

sentences.english: Mr. Xu tried to courteously reject, but Qing Qing has already put dishes and fruits on the table.
sentences.chinese: 许仙想推辞，却见青青已经把瓜果菜肴摆上了桌。

sentences.english: Shrimp in stir fry is my favorite dish.
sentences.chinese: 炒虾子是我对喜欢的菜肴。

sentences.english: In China, I loved the hot Sichuan food and enjoyed the delicious Beijing snacks.
sentences.chinese: 在中国，我非常喜欢四川的酸辣菜肴和北京小吃。

sentences.english: Xuxian wanted to refuse but Qingqing had allocated dishes and fruits on the desk swiftly.
sentences.chinese: 许仙想推辞，却见青青已经把瓜果菜肴摆上了桌。

definition: dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
to smell, look and taste great
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
